title: Can not connect to server
body: I just uninstalled the game due to it say unable to connect to server check your firewall. I was just on the game. I did a repair earlier. So I uninstalled the game and installed it and still same thing pops up. WHY? When riot put that patch in it has been nothing but hassles and now cant get back on the game. What do I do now?

replies.body: First stop is the [Connection Troubleshooting Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues). Perform all the steps there and let me know if that doesn't help.

Thank you for responding. That did help and was able to reinstall the game. I am able to play which I am happy. One thing is the ms is higher then normal and don't know why. I usually sit between 28-30 and now it is between 32-38. Also the loading for match to begin is long and people are dc. I wait it out and game begins.

The slightly higher latency could be a number of things, but ~10 ms is extremely insignificant to the point that it's actually humanly impossible to notice. I wouldn't even bother investigating the cause unless it continues to rise regularly or have large spikes/packet loss.

It sounds like your network is having trouble establishing a connection to the server, which would prevent you from loading the patcher or logging in.  I agree with DTN that the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide would be a great first step to troubleshoot this.  I also recommend downloading the [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs) which can help configure your firewall to allow League access.  Hope that helps!
